story.storybody:
In wake of the recent terror attacks, both India and US have signed an agreement to share real time terrorist screening and exchange of information, so that preventive measure can be taken on time.

The exchange of terrorist screening information arrangement was signed by Union Home Secretary Rajiv Mehrishi and US Ambassador to India Richard Verma.

HERE'S WHAT YOU SHOULD KNOW:

{funfacts}
  1. As per this agreement, both sides shall provide each other access to terrorism screening information through the designated contact points, subject to domestic laws and regulations.
  2. The agreement was signed today by Union Home Secretary Rajiv Mehrishi and US Ambassador to India Richard Verma.
  3. The arrangement would enhance the counter terrorism cooperation between India and USA.
  4. The database will help security agencies keep a tab on suspicious travellers.
  5. The Modi government had recently decided not to join a global terror database maintained by the US after the security agencies raised objections over it.
{funfacts}
